Hi Max, I just took a look and see that there is a theme pending approval. Were you able to resolve the issue?
Hi Brennan! I’m taking a look at this now

Hi Brennan, it looks like there are two main issues:
- Modules need icons added
- Several templates (I believe just blog templates) are using absolute paths for modules when they should be relative

Feel free to send me a DM if you have any questions.
Hi Mike, taking a look now

Hi Mike, it looks like you have 2 themes in ‘draft’ state currently. Atlas appears to be error-free, the other theme has the following errors:
- Modules need icons added
- Several templates (I believe just blog templates) are using absolute paths for modules when they should be relative.
Hi Moadh, I know that we spoke directly, but just want to confirm that you were able to resolve the issue.

Atlas by Kalungi
:thumbsup: I’ll take a look now
Thanks for all your help <@U22PWJ41G>! Really appreciate it

Apologies for the poor error messaging
Ahh got it. Ok ok
Please let me know if you’re still having issues after connecting the account.
Hi everyone + <@UNQ6UDGSJ>, we're also running into a small issue for our submission. Portal ID: 313589.
<@U01FC7EUL5T>  refresh the page

Will do. I need to get hold of HR person to get this setup – I’m not sure when I’ll be able to connect with them. Will I still be able to submit the theme later today or early tomorrow morning for the contest?

<@U01FC7EUL5T> I was able to get it to work on my end (but don't want to submit on your behalf). It looks like it you wait ~ 30 seconds - 1 minute and refresh it worked for me. Could you try that out and let me know if you are still running into this issue?
Same issue here. Final step, portal id: 1428728
No worries. I’m adding a note now to your form submission so that the rest of the folks on our end are aware of the situation
Taking a look now
that did the trick! thanks. and should be submitted now.
It looks like you need a `screenshot_path` in your theme.json file.
Did you try refreshing the page? Were you able to submit or were there errors that popped up?
He's been retrying for about 12 hours
nm, just saw that he got it
thanks for all your guys' help!
Thanks, Chris
No problem! You’re all set.
Oh okay, missed that, thanks!
No problem!
I've added that, but it's still returning an error. Could it be something else?
Taking a look now
We require that all paths are relative and it looks like you’re using an absolute path. Do you mind updating?
OK, that's done. Still getting a validation problem though.
Taking a look
I just tried submitting and it went through as expected. I think you’re all set!
oh okay, maybe it's cached on my screen. thanks for the help! :slightly_smiling_face:
It very well could have been a cache. Glad that we were able to get everything resolved!

Hi Everyone! I have a couple of questions pertaining to a theme on the marketplace. My theme was approved and is not published (yay!). There are some features and thing I would like to tweak / add.

1.  After I add those to the ‘master’ files, do I have to re-submit to the marketplace and wait for approval again or how does that work?
2. If anyone has purchased my theme, will my updates be free for them to download to their existing portal?
3. Do my updates overwrite anything they have or is it a new copy of the entire theme?

Hey Sam :wave: congrats on getting your theme approved!
1.) If you'd like to make an update to one of your assets you'd go to your marketplace listings > click on the gear icon to the right of the listing you want to update > click edit listing and go through the regular submission process.
2.) Yes the updates will be free to download to their existing portal if you update your theme. For a customer to update their theme they'd need to go to the marketplace from within their portal and update the asset from the "Purchased" tab.
3.) Yes your theme files are readonly in the customers portal so any changes you make will be reflected in the customers portal if they download your update.
Thanks for the quick response. I did not know the theme files were read only.  Interesting. They can not adjust the theme at all if they wanted something more custom?
some css changes or anything like that?
The user can clone the original theme in their portal if they want to make any adjustments to it. Outside of that, at least for right now, the user can't make edits to the original downloaded theme.
gotcha. Interesting indeed.
as far as a workflow goes, do you recommend cloning a theme or if a theme has a long term plan of being supported, to just use the read only from the start so updates are a little easier?
I guess im more asking for what is the best practice for clients using themes. Should they stick with the read only and take the updates or clone and modify?
Yep, just needed to update the icons - thanks
Thanks for the help! I was able to get everything validated and submitted on the marketplace for approval!

Sorry I think I missed one way that a user could modify a theme. A user could add additional style-sheets/JS files from their site settings if they want to make modifications that way. In terms of the other questions - I think it depends on the customer. Generally speaking I'd probably recommend someone uses the default theme so that they can pull down updates (users should be able to modify what they need using theme settings/with the DND page editor) but if someone was looking to use your theme as a starting point vs. a finished product then cloning it and modifying it would probably make more sense.

That makes sense and it was what I was thinking, just wanted to verify. If I make updates to a module, those updates will be auto rolled out if they are using the default theme and the update, correct?
sorry, that is my actual last question :smile:

No worries! Correct any asset that you update (modules, template, partials, theme settings) will update if the user is using the default theme and downloads the update. One important note would be that module/partial/theme setting changes could impact live content on a user's website whereas a change to the template wouldn't impact a users live website because the page was already created from the template (therefore template changes no longer impact that particular page but would impact new pages created from that template moving forward).
thanks for all the info! Have a great holiday break!
Thank you - you too!
